task_summary: Pick up the green glass bottle and place it down on the table area, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base robot arm operates over a white tabletop with several objects, including a green glass bottle, a red bottle, a blue can, and stacked orange cylinders. The goal is to place down the green glass bottle in a clear table region visible in later frames. The behavior tree first localizes the target, prepares the gripper, plans a side grasp, verifies the computed pose, grasps, lifts, transfers to a safe placement zone, lowers and places the bottle, releases it, and retreats. Timeouts, distances and forces are snapped to allowed bins for safety and repeatability.
preconditions: Green glass bottle visible on the table
Robot has free workspace to the right-side placement area
Robot within reach of the bottle and placement zone
stepwise_plan: Detect the green glass bottle and open the gripper.
Approach above the bottle and compute a side grasp pose.
Verify the grasp pose key is available; execute grasp and close gripper.
Check grasp stability and lift/transfer above placement area.
Place down onto the table, open gripper to release.
Retreat and briefly wait to stabilize.
success_criteria: Bottle rests stably upright on the target table area
Robot retreats clear of the object
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-run detection or widen view (not encoded here).
If grasp is unstable, re-compute grasp pose and retry grasp.
If contact not detected during placing, extend PlaceDown timeout and lower again.
If collisions are imminent, retreat and re-approach above the placement area.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after successful release, retreat, and a short wait.

frame_3.now_evidence: Fingers closing around the green bottle; first secure grasp moment is visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Lifting and transfer should follow immediately after grasp completion.

node_specs.description: Detect the specified object within timeout.
Move above target with Z offset.
Compute grasp and store pose key.
Verify computed pose exists on blackboard.
Lower to surface and prepare release.
Back off from the placed object.

failure_modes: Target not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Grasp slip on the glass surface
Collision with nearby objects during transfer
recovery_strategy: Re-compute grasp with alternative strategy (top) and retry
Raise and re-route above clutter, then re-approach
Re-place with slower descent and verified contact
assumptions: The green bottle in frames is glass and the intended target.
Placement region corresponds to a free table area on the right; encoded as 'place_on_table'.
PlaceDown handles controlled descent before release; OpenGripper performs the actual release.

expected_success_criteria: Bottle stands upright on table after release
No object displacement beyond minimal tolerance
Robot ends clear of the object
